conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to calculate the magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the current-carrying wire.
The Ampere force is given by the equation: F_A = (mu_0 I L)/2.
mu_0 is the permeability of free space (4π × 10^-7 T·m/A), I is the current in the wire, L is the length of the wire.
Given: L = 3L, I = I, B is the magnetic induction intensity.
The total length of the folded wire is ac + cd = L + 2L = 3L.
Calculate the magnetic flux through the wire: Phi = B * L * 3L = 3BL.
The magnetic force on the wire is given by: F_A = (mu_0 I L)/2.
Substitute the values: F_A = ((4π × 10^-7 T·m/A) * I * 3L)/2.
Simplify the expression: F_A = (12π × 10^-7 I L)/2.
The magnitude of the Ampere force acting on the current-carrying wire is 6π × 10^-7 I L.
